title: Question 20
prompt: Mort puts a temperature thermometer in a roast beef to check the temperature as he cooks it. As soon as the temperature hits 145<sup>o</sup> F, he immediately serves the roast. Has Mort cooked the roast sufficiently to kill harmful bacteria?
description:
Click the one best answer to each question.

USDA food temperature guidelines are designed to kill harmful bacteria in foods.
feedback: The guidelines state that a roast needs to cook at 145<sup>o</sup> F for 4 minutes. Serving the roast immediately means that the roast may not be at a high enough temperature long enough to kill all bacteria.
